section1.title: 1. Purpose of Data Collection
section1.content: TechFlow processes personal information for the following purposes. The collected information is not used for other purposes, and if the purpose changes, separate consent will be obtained as required by the Personal Information Protection Act.

section2.title: 2. Information Collected
section2.content: TechFlow collects the following personal information for membership, consultation, and service applications:
items: Required: Email address, password, name, mobile number
Auto-collected: IP address, cookies, visit time, service usage history, device info

section3.title: 3. Retention Period
section3.content: TechFlow promptly deletes information when the purpose of collection is fulfilled. However, certain information may be retained as required by applicable laws.

section4.title: 4. Third-Party Sharing
section4.content: TechFlow processes personal information only within the scope specified in Section 1 and provides it to third parties only with user consent or as required by law.

section5.title: 5. User Rights
section5.content: Users may exercise the following rights regarding their personal information: view, correct errors, request deletion, or suspend processing.

section6.title: 6. Privacy Officer
section6.content: TechFlow has appointed a privacy officer responsible for handling complaints and providing remedies related to personal information processing. Privacy Officer: John Doe (Contact: privacy@techflow.work)

section1.title: 1. General
section1.content: These Terms of Service ("Terms") govern the use of services provided by TechFlow ("Company") and define the rights, obligations, and responsibilities between the Company and users.

section2.title: 2. Definitions
section2.content: Terms used in these Terms are defined as follows:
items: "Service" means all services provided by the Company through websites, mobile applications, and other platforms.
"User" means any individual who accesses and uses the Service under these Terms.
"Account" means the combination of ID and password required to use the Service.
"Content" means all information created, uploaded, shared, or stored by users while using the Service.

section3.title: 3. Amendments
section3.content: The Company may amend these Terms when necessary and will notify users of changes at least 7 days before implementation. For significant changes disadvantageous to users, notice will be given at least 30 days in advance.

section4.title: 4. Service Agreement
section4.content: The service agreement is formed when a user agrees to these Terms and the Company approves registration. The Company may refuse registration in cases of false information, previously suspended users, or technical impossibility.

section5.title: 5. User Obligations
section5.content: Users must not engage in the following: illegal acts, intellectual property violations, service disruption, spreading false information, or other activities deemed inappropriate by the Company.

section6.title: 6. Service Provision
section6.content: The Company strives to provide 24/7 service but may temporarily suspend service for maintenance, repairs, replacements, or other technical reasons. The Company may change all or part of the Service for technical or operational reasons.

section7.title: 7. Termination
section7.content: Users may request termination at any time. The Company may restrict service or terminate the agreement if a user violates these Terms or harms other users or service operations.

section8.title: 8. Intellectual Property
section8.content: All intellectual property rights related to the Service belong to the Company or respective rights holders. Users may not use information obtained through the Service for commercial purposes or provide it to third parties without prior consent.

section9.title: 9. Governing Law
section9.content: These Terms are governed by and interpreted according to the laws of the Republic of Korea. Disputes will be resolved through consultation between the Company and users, and if unresolved, may be filed in the competent court.
